answers.text: @saya_mr_g they ask all they want. You do what you are capable of and happy with. It your parents are also that shallow then sad life for you.
@snowbreeeze its weird how you assume I'm chinese. You do realise that i would understand what you are trying to say...

@snowbreeeze chill bro!!there really is a problem with our education system and this whole “stigma” thing . It’s really sad but unfortunately that’s really common in countries like Singapore , Hong Kong , South Korea etc etc

@snowbreeeze it’s easy to say that from an outsiders perspective dood . Different people have different emotional tolerance and different people handle stress differently . It’s not so much about how stressed someone is and dealing with it but instead why are they feeling so much more stressed?

@ooweewawa you choose to embroil yourself in a academic fight you can't win.  Why don't you think out of the box and enjoy the childhood? Why you need to play along w the stigma? Does stigma determine who you are? Seriously... 🤦‍♂️
@ooweewawa why do u even bother entertaining ignorant people like him lmao dont waste ur time

@snowbreeeze my parents , uncles and aunties , family friends and essentially most adults can speak for this . 20 years ago , you can still get into foreign universities even if u didn’t do well for a levels for example . It’s different now , every exam is a do or die , no “high level of education” = no job in our highly competitive society . The amount of content we are learning now , is way harder than it was 20 years ago . Imagine the same head taking in so much more information . This can be backed by suicide rates in Singapore , which has climbed drastically the last 30 years . While the emotional well-being of today’s youth is evidently weaker , it is often linked to the stresses that 1. Our education covers 2. The amount of pressure received from everyone else
@snowbreeeze haha

@snowbreeeze the workload is so much heavier than what you probably went though years ago . I don’t even know how to explain how stressful it is . Students who have already survived through the stresses of psle and o levels find this even more stressful

@ooweewawa he's simply seeking the attention that he has been deprived of. Focus on ur HBL dude, im a student just like u, so long as u know that ur putting in the hard work, thats sufficient... U dont need the validation from others
@snowbreeeze YES BUT MY WHOLE ENTIRE POINT IS THAT MANY PEOPLE IN SOCIETY STILL BELIEVE THAT YOU HAVE TO DO WELL TO SUCCEED .that may not be me but there are still so many people with that thinking

@snowbreeeze I honestly think you don’t realised what you’ve just done . I may have used vulgarities , which for the record is prevalent in our society (lol?) but you’ve completely attempted to deviate your insults away

@snowbreeeze pls enlighten me . In what way have I not seen sense? Tell me what I’m “not seeing” . I srsly don’t understand what you’re saying cos each rely from you is completely irrelevant to what I’ve said before

@snowbreeeze you generalized too much, it shows your shallowness in understanding that there are different types of students. (Some are lazy, but not all). And now there's actually more workload. Some of our assignments are given and must be submitted on the same day, so we actually have less time for certain homework. Curriculum time is actually longer, for eg. some jc have a timetable for tutorials that ends at 2/3? then after tutorials still need to watch lectures for each  of the 7 subjects (and each lecture is around 1/1.5hr long and has a quiz)

@ooweewawa really low class family you are from. 1960s.  Behahahha.. You are really funny. I pity your parents.  What a bafoon you are.. That's why I say education is impt. But not at the expense of character building.. Sheesh
@ooweewawa democracy doesn't mean vulgarities and using degratory terms like you. You need a big lesson. You have the issues not me 🤦‍♂️🤡🐓

@snowbreeeze yes and I can speak for this considering my mum teaches at ite . Unfortunately , the way our education is shaped is that that’s the last resort , unintentionally creating a stigma . So it isn’t exactly the fault of our parents because this entire stigma has already been existent for years
@snowbreeeze asian values can be put into English words right? If you were to use chinese words to say something to me and want me to understand, it would mean you are assuming I'm chinese.
@snowbreeeze do you even know how much our workload is? An average junior college student starts at 730 and stares at the screen , with hardly any breaks until 530 in the evening
@ooweewawa you are condemning all none elite schools. Sadly. I been to more places than you.  You should open up your views. Its really myopic. Sad. 🤦‍♂️
@snowbreeeze most people don’t see that way . Stress has become secondary to good grades and being successful and that was shaped by our present day education system , so just sayin
@gforgeraldo like I said. There's always a choice.

@ooweewawa sorry. Doesn't matter how many. It's a matter of principle. I disagree with your views and even more so when you claim your mother teaches in ITE.  i pity you.  The type of upbringing that you have.. Esp from a teacher. 🤦‍♂️🤡🐓
@ooweewawa if im wrong means the stigma is right. Sorry. I'm not wrong. 🤦‍♂️ 🤡 🐓
@ooweewawa I think you don't realise how was it years ago versus now. It'd easy to criticise when you didn't go thru it. So... Yep.

@snowbreeeze you know what , I think you can find a job as an interpreter at the Moscow circus or smth . Throughout our entire “argument” , you have not backed your entire argument with as little as a single piece of information . Our education is easier now? Prove it with facts . There’s no stigma?come to school and find out . It’s funny , saying that we have no respect for insulting you but here you are calling students lazy , bafoons ( that isn’t even an English word FYI)
@gforgeraldo look inwards and ask yourselves frankly what you want in your life. Don't regret later for a stupid reason like pride. Or stigma.

@snowbreeeze that’s the sad thing . Many parents and relatives enjoy asking where so where do u study , what’s your psle score and o level score , and when one shares non-optimal results , they get put down , and that’s how this whole vicious cycle works

@snowbreeeze yes , it’s not the end . But many people in society continue to revolve around the prospect of getting into a university and this not only increases the competitiveness between students , pitting them against one another .
@ooweewawa u taking alvl this yr too?

@snowbreeeze I still remember your old bio. “Here to discipline kids because their parents don’t teach them” or something along the lines of that. But here you are, being immature and discrediting actual hardworking students.

@ooweewawa if can't study. Then go to a lower stream. That's how to mitigate stress.  Overseas unis are ez.  But if you can't qualify for local ones then do the private ones locally.  Still recognised.  But if your family cannot be seen as having a kid in normal stream or ITE.. Then it's a family issue.

@snowbreeeze it’s not easy for anyone to think that way . As @ooweewawa pointed out , there’s a stigma of being “dropped to a lower stream” so in general , no one wants to do that , out of “their pride “ and other people’s opinions .

@snowbreeeze my whole point is , just because SOME students were happy with hbl , I can speak for the majority and say the past few weeks and today have been filled with high levels of stress , especially for the students taking national exams this year for example .

@snowbreeeze I think you need to realise that this is Singapore , an our entire society is revolves around doing your best , scoring high grades . In that sense , our teaches , parents , even classmates place that thinking that going to ite is the worst , dropping a stream is horrendous . So in that sense , you can’t change that

@snowbreeeze I’m not talking about myself , for the record . The general population of students in Singapore face stress , and when that happens stop blaming the students for their failure of handling stress cos this entire system has “groomed” them to be like that . What you need to understand is that as much as one needs to learn how to handle stress , if so many students have to handle that amount of stress , then isn’t that an indication that there’s smth wrong with the way society thinks and how the system is imposed on students ? Once again , I’m going to emphasise that especially in Singapore , if so many students feel stress , our society still deems lowering to a lower standard as bad so naturally no one would want to ( that can’t even be debated by u okay ) . And just for the sake of saying this , you’re upset that “insulting you” but In just as smth as simple as the comment I’m replying to , you can say “ I’m sorry your parents didn’t teach you how to handle stress” , and “ you light me one of them that isn’t cut out to do well academically “ , so don’t go around saying people are trying to insult you when you’re clearly stooping to an even lower level

@snowbreeeze basically , he’s saying that this stigma is a bad thing and I don’t see how in any way he has insulted non express and ib kids . As an adult , I think we should all view things from different perspectives , in this case , he is right , because this is an issue that many students face today
@gforgeraldo it is. Its up to your parents.  If they also insist tha you chase the paper then sad life for you.
@snowbreeeze actually cb ends 1 june. genius lol.

@snowbreeeze hey , yes he shouldn’t have used vulgarities but I think you need to know that as much as the three of us don’t want to be part of it , this stigma has shaped our entire education system , like it or not and this is the problem he is bringing up . We may not want to be part of it , but our society has unintentionally encouraged this

@snowbreeeze bro , no . It isn’t the end of the road , yes . There are so many opportunities out there for everyone regardless of how academically inclined one person is . But right , this whole stigma thing makes MANY PEOPLE think that it’s bad to get into ite and such , and that affects the mental stability of many students
@saya_mr_g we have a choice. Don't make it as if we don't.  You 2 are just insistent it's the only way. It isn't.
@hiiiiiiiiiiiii__7 that's better. I never fail to account.  Just that talent is one thing... Hard work is another.  Seriously... If you need to work triple as hard.. Then something is wrong.
@snowbreeeze and you do know that the workload is much more right?
@gforgeraldo if stress until break the no choice. It's life deal w it.
@ooweewawa you can don't do well and succeed in life. The rest is up to you. 🤦‍♂️

@snowbreeeze welp , because clearly using uncap words and maybe even vulgarities can’t help you understand the realities of our earth and our society . You’ve been on this earth longer than me , have been to more places , fine , but remember this , just because you’re older doesn’t mean you understand what the difference between reality and fiction is . In case you haven’t realised that you’ve incurred the wrath of students that work hard all for adults to come and criticise and discredit us , and then followed by insults directed at our upbringing and then complaining abo us using vulgarities , it’s time you wake up because this new generation have seen first-hand the level of stupidity people like you possess
@osinshsjs ya. All lazing at home and skipping lessons.  Sad sad kiddos. 🤦‍♂️🤡🐓
@ooweewawa I disagree. It's a stigma yes. But to say the whole country is in it is too broadstroke.

@snowbreeeze parents are the decision makers , yes , but there are many other people that influence both the student and the parents and naturally most people won’t want their child “ to drop a stream” or go to “ite” because unfortunately , many in Singapore still think that’s the last resort and would rather their child not pursue that path . It’s actually really common to see that . In my school , after the Sec 3 promotional exams , many are offered the choice of dropping to normal academic or retain and many parents would come to school begging the Teachers for a second chance , so that kinda shows that it’s not as easy to “ drop a stream” because of various factors these parents , Teachers and students consider
@ooweewawa the moment you use vulgarities you lose. Trust me. That's real life. You are living a lie.

@snowbreeeze One more thing, I assume you're an adult, so as an adult I'm sure you're matured enough to have the ability and knowledge of thinking from other's perspective. Try looking at the conversation in this entire comments section from a different view point (one from the students). I'm sure you as a matured adult would have the ability to empathise right?
@snowbreeeze look , that hasn’t happened to me yet but I’m not blaming society , I’m saying that this is common in society and this is because of stereotypes and the culture many people have
@gabythedady bwhahah
@ooweewawa streaming has its pros and cons.  But if one is in the know then can work things out. Its never the end.. Learning can be thru many paths.
@snowbreeeze lemme just got back to my hbl because it’s so “easy” right . Try learning what we learn boomer 😱😭😭😭
@ooweewawa break down means can't handle. Cant handle means toughen up or drop a standard.  That's life. Failures never end.

@snowbreeeze that’s your opinion . But sadly , most parents and educators in Singapore think otherwise , grooming students to do this and do that . If it isn’t the kid stressing him or herself up , it’s the stress imposed on them by the people around them. Society has worked in a way where people naturally look down on each other for being in a slower stream , or being in ite for example , and that can’t change bcos it’s a problem many developed countries face
@hiiiiiiiiiiiii__7 I don't empathise people who make a voluntary choice to abuse themselves.

@snowbreeeze I think you don’t realise how hard the average student works . Take starting school at 730 , ending lessons at 3,4 and having COMPULSORY  ccas till 730 ( a whoopin 12 hours in school ) . 12 hours in school , can you seriously stand there and say is isn’t a problem with our system?
@osinshsjs sorry I don't discredit anyone. I refer to those that begged literally for school closures. Now they all gone quiet.  Hardworking? I hope so... Doubt it. 🤦‍♂️🤡🐓
@snowbreeeze can’t forget you. Always acting like all “kiddos” are lazy and asked for longer circuit breaker.

@gforgeraldo like I said. There's always a choice. But if your mind or your family's mind is closed... Then there's no other way. You will realise this next time when you grow up and out in the workforce.

@ooweewawa wrong. The system is for people to exploit or use.  If your parents refuse to play by it then you won't suffer.  It's a choice. Always has been. Nornal stream isn't the end. Even ITE isn't the end. 🤦‍♂️

@snowbreeeze my entire point , in case you haven’t realised , is not that I’m part of this stigma or that this stigma is right or wrong but that it is the reason why people are so afraid of not doing well academically and if you can’t think out of the box in this case , you have very very poor analytical skills .
@snowbreeeze bro , what do you think our views are , like seriously? Cos I think you’re confused rn
@saya_mr_g vulgarities = aggressive? I know of cse theres a stigma. But why will we wanna be part of it? Enough said.
@snowbreeeze i completely agree with u
@snowbreeeze that's crazy and all, but I don't remember asking👀👀
@snowbreeeze what do you mean? im simply asking you to empathise because its a mature thing to do (at least that's what teachers teach during civics)
@gforgeraldo sad for the kids. There's always a choice like I said.

@ooweewawa seriously.. I offered the way forward if you can't do well. If you can't accept it then don't. But don't need to attempt to win by insulting others with hateful words.  Seriously. What facts do you want? Or you can't see the facts I told you. Enjoy your education. Stop being so myopic.

@snowbreeeze yes, we do have a choice . But , the sad reality is that unfortunately , our schools , families and teachers many of which have a certain view of ite and na , like it or not . It’s bad to impose stereotypes on them and look down on them , but that’s really common
@ooweewawa I used to go home at 11pm. So nah.. Its not a big surprise.
@ooweewawa you want to be the same with everyone go ahead. It's a choice. Stigma or not. Too bad for you then.
@saya_mr_g yesh. Not everyone is inclined. But they are no condemned. Surely not. You 2 have extremist views of not good academically means end of life. It isn't. Stigma or no stigma.
@ooweewawa oh my... I typed nicely and then I realised you are trying v hard to insult me. Good lucky trying. 🤦‍♂️ 🤡 🐓

@snowbreeeze this is funny . If I’m really lacking “ a proper upbringing “ and “am lacking principles” why would you report a comment about bullying when I’m stating the facts that people have been criticising you? Unless you refuse to admit you’re wrong about making assumptions then I can safely say that your mindset is beyond help

@snowbreeeze hi! I don’t want to start a fight with you but I think you are missing his whole point , which is the truth . There is a stigma present , and he isn’t saying that it’s wrong or right , just saying that this stigma is around and it exists . As much as he sounds aggressive , I hope you got the message that hey , in this case you’re wrong dude
@snowbreeeze vulgarities do not reflect ones level of education . You may or may not say vulgarities , but your level of thinking reflects more of the lack of critical thinking you have

@snowbreeeze excuse me . You’ve insulted me throughout and my stand throughout is that you cannot assume that our education is easy . It isn’t . No ones condemning anyone but my entire point is that this stigma is extremely prevalent in schools , elite or non-elite this stigma is still common . Don’t you dare say I have improper upbringing cos at least I’m stating facts that can be backed by evidence and interestingly enough , you haven’t done the same . You’re constantly deviating away from the points I’m rebutting against you and at the end of the day you can say that I have poor upbringing . I think you’re completely misunderstanding my views . Our education is harder than it was 20 years ago , and that isn’t even just my opinion , it’s a fact that can be verified if you 1. Look at our syllabus content 2. Search . Secondly , my so called “view” that the stress levels of students are extremely high the last few years , can be backed by evidence too . For the last time , I’d repeat . We have a competitive education system ( has its pros and cons ) but cons wise , when people fight for the same grade and the same place , naturally people will feel pressured and stressed to perform even better ( this isn’t even just a family thing ) , it’s how our society works . Good education = high-paying job , that’s the way our society thinks . It’s a matter of principle? Yes , except the fact that the points made by everyone rebutting you is based on principles that you don’t assume people don’t work hard and that people aren’t academically inclined . At this point , I hope you realise I’m not speaking on my part , but merely reflecting what the average students goes through every single day . This entire vicious cycle . I’m not saying our education system should be done away with , I’m just saying that 1. Stress levels among students have been high because of a a competitive system and 2. There’s obviously a stigma that dropping a stream or going to ite is the last resort and should be avoided . I don’t think that way but naturally this is the case in our society
@snowbreeeze u are right
@gforgeraldo Stigm stuck w student? Gosh. Grow up la!!

@snowbreeeze that’s the thing . Exactly , you’ve proved our points . A student spent a roughly 20+ years in our education system so for these 20 years , this exists . It’s different in the working world and yes people will have a shock when they start working but the point is that living directly under the system that’s what exists .
@hiiiiiiiiiiiii__7 shallowness because I disagree.. Seriously. I think rewording your statement is a good idea. People can misunderstand or not get you. But i dont call you shallow.
@ooweewawa lol. You are assuming again. Seriously. Its much easier now. You just can't appreciate the conveniences that you enjoy now.  Light workload.... You must be joking. 🤦‍♂️🤡🐓

@snowbreeeze yes , it’s never the end . Unfortunately , it’s not as simple as that . In Singapore , many parents invest lots of money into tuition and extra-curricular activities so obviously they expect smth from the child . I won’t say the parents failed him or her because this is the way our society functions nowadays . As a country gets richer and more developed , a greater emphasis on education is placed , meaning parents invest more money into a child’s education because at the end of the day , they think a better education = a higher-paying job ( cos not everyone can become a businessman right ) so obviously these parents will expect good grades from their children
@snowbreeeze no , not for the students  life but at the very least during his or her years of education . I think maybe you should see how our students are today and then come back

@snowbreeeze you seem like a really myopic person, you should try to do some reading or research into how stressful students are these days. I agree that one can drop streams if they cant cope, but we have to look at facts first. How many people actually can make it in life with a decent paying job without graduating with a degree or a diploma from poly? Honestly, I think you're the one living a lie, thinking that the education system is perfect or whatever. It isn't because it causes a stigma around dropping steams etc. I'm from a neighborhood sch and some teachers are say, "Y'all better work hard or later end up in ite." What does that imply? What kind of education is that? I'm pretty sure that my sch or my teacher isnt the only one saying this sort of remarks. This kind of 'threats' by a teacher to encourage students to do well is supporting a stigma around ite etc. So to say that the stigma is not stuck is wrong. I'll admit some of us would find it silly eventually, but not all, because the stigma stays (teachers teach students this, students grow up using this, as students are impressionable and are taught to listen to teachers etc)
@gabythedady ignorance breeds from poor education.
@gforgeraldo yes it's not simple. Or easy. But there's a choice. Always rem that
@snowbreeeze tbvh I’m sick and tired of this . Your self-absorbed mind is so fixed on your opinions that you’re not even seeing how the people commenting on your comment are arguing with facts

@snowbreeeze that’s subjective . Many people have different perceptions of what their priorities are . As an outsider , you technically can not assume one method works for everyone . It’s very easy for an outsider like you to say that people need to get over their failure and take a step back if they need to . However , different people have different mindsets and different level of thinking so this whole thing about look inwards , while people can do it , it doesn’t work for everyone or rather it’s not as easy as it is to do that .

@snowbreeeze pls read all the previous comments made by other accounts . If all of us are really having the so called “myopic vision” and if all of us are all wrong , maybe it’s time to evaluate wether maybe you’re the one that’s been wrong in assuming and wrong in justifying in the first place
@gabythedady dang
@snowbreeeze btw i am chinese, im just saying you are assuming. here's something for you ：牛皮灯笼点不亮.

@snowbreeeze I’m talking about in general , most kids go through that now , rather than “an individual” . Essentially , when the stresses of class work, cca , homework , household chores pile on students day after day , most feel increasingly stressed

@snowbreeeze he isn’t . I have cousins in the normal technical stream and my brother flunked psle and I can reassure you he isn’t . He isn’t even criticising anyone . His entire point is that our system has this stigma and that’s an issue
@hiiiiiiiiiiiii__7  I'm sad for your parents. Totally impossible to talk to. Your views are closed.  Probably your parents too. 🤦‍♂️🐓🤡

@snowbreeeze it isn’t the end . Yes . But the way adults , Teachers and essentially everyone put it is that “ you have to make sure you don’t go to normal or don’t go to ite” . My Mum teaches at ite while my two aunts teach at a primary school and the other teaches at sajc and it’s a common phenomena they see students breaking down from the amount of stress imposed onto then
@ooweewawa not interested in kiddos who are poorly brought up. Vulgarities is not socially accepted. Idc what you feel or think before you decided to use vulgarities. Sorry. 🤦‍♂️🤡🐓
@ooweewawa sad for you. You are just impossible to see sense.

@snowbreeeze no, again you’re missing the whole point . Your arguments are all flawed with the lack of evidence and yet you continue criticising students , basically saying that our stress is unexplainable and as if that’s our fault . What I’m trying to say is , it’s time you open your eyes and see the 40+ comments trying to correct your statement but obviously all you care about now is “trying very hard to insult me.good luck trying” . For the record , I’m not trying to insult you , I’m trying to “educate you”
@ooweewawa see. Vulgarities. So much for having an education.
@snowbreeeze damn i thought you disappeared lol
@azri_hafidz they cut the source the infection ends. I think their actions are a bit over the top actually. But what to do?

@ooweewawa no. You are the missing the point. If by insulting me you think you will win the argument you are so wrong.  I say again for you to process. Stress is unavoidable. If you can't handle stress then find ways to reduce it. If not stop everything.  Lowering to another standard is the best way if you can't keep up. I'm sorry your parents didn't teach you how to manage stress. Not everyone is cut out to do well academically. You might be one of them 🤦‍♂️🤡🐓
@etaniareye that was posted b4 the school hols revised. Come on la🤦‍♂️🤡🐓
@hiiiiiiiiiiiii__7 子不学父之过。 Go learn your values before you reply. 🤦‍♂️
@ooweewawa up to you to distort. Just stop your behaviour. It's not acceptable outside.

@snowbreeeze once again , you are not understanding our point . This system is here to stay , yes . I’m not even stressed tbvh but I’m speaking for the thousands of students that have gone through this vicious cycle of stress , and that’s not even considering their parents . Even for students in the normal streams , the fear of not being able to find. High-paying job is prevalent , and for students in the express stream , the fear would be performing badly for one exam . Yes , this is meritocracy and I’m not saying it isn’t fair people are suffering more than others . What I’m saying is that your argument that “our education is easier than it was years ago” is completely wrong
@ooweewawa see? Another unwanted insult. I type nicely. Go boomz your grandparents. Stop pretending the whole world are boomers. Grow up.

@snowbreeeze yep , there’s always a choice . But in the status quo, as students , there’s often a stereotype that dropping a stream or going to ite is “the end of the world”. This definitely isn’t the case say 10-15 years down the road but this stigma will last with a student for many years , or at least during the years of his studies and that few years can take a huge toll and scar a human being for life , and that’s the worry
@snowbreeeze no it’s not always because of parents . Schools and Teachers generally play a similar part
@snowbreeeze no I’m from a neighbourhood school and I can safely say this is extremely prevalent . How neighbourhood is my secondary school?psle cop 188 so yeah
@saya_mr_g tell that to the minister. Seriously. Your views are not the truth

@hiiiiiiiiiiiii__7 sorry. Using Chinese words doesn't assume you are Chinese. That's racist to start with from you. It's Asian values. And if you claim not to be Asian then too bad for you that SG is an Asian country with Asian values.
@ooweewawa no excuse. Doesn't matter if I'm right or wrong. No excuse from you. If I were you I will be so ashamed. Using vulgarities has no place in our society. End of story.

@snowbreeeze dood , are u kidding me . Have u seen our workload?
